body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! Thank you for contacting Green Hospitality. My name is Raymond Green. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hello, my name is Michelle Bryant.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Nice to meet you, Michelle. How are you feeling today?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I'm sorry to hear that. I hope I can assist you. Could you provide me with your room number and the date of your check-in for verification purposes?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: My room number is three two four and I checked in on the first of October.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for that information, Michelle. One final request, could you please confirm the last four digits of the credit card used for booking?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Sure, it's seven eight nine zero.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for verifying that information, Michelle. I will look into your concern. Is there anything else you would like to add before I proceed?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for your time, Michelle. I will address the issue of the clean towels. Have a pleasant day.
